scene.name: intro
scene.option: I didn't think you were coming back.
Did you find what you were looking for?

scene.name: didnt-think-coming
scene.line: Sure I was. Why wouldn't I be?
scene.option: Did you find what you were looking for?

scene.name: looking-for
scene.line: Yeah ... Maybe. Look, we're not going to talk about that anymore, OK?

scene.name: intro-sorry
scene.line: No, I'm sorry. I'm just on edge. I'll be ok once I get away from this mine.

scene.name: leg
scene.option: I can walk on it, but it's slow.
I can walk on it, but it's painful.

scene.name: leg-slow
scene.line: Well, I'll try not to get too far ahead of you. You don't mind my hitching a ride, do you? I kinda got a lift out here, and wasn't sure if, uh â€” when I'd be heading back. I can drive.

scene.name: leg-painful
scene.line: Oh. I've got some painkillers here that could help you out. I got them from a friend when I sprained my wrist installing a security system. You'd better let me drive, though. They're pretty strong.

scene.name: shannon-will-drive
scene.line: Don't worry: I've been driving since I was nine.

scene.name: next-steps
scene.option: I still need to find the |Zero|.
I guess I should look for another route to Dogwood Drive.

scene.name: zero
scene.line: Well, it's like I told you: Weaver doesn't lie. If she sent you here to find your onramp, this is where you should be looking. Or maybe you just weren't listening closely enough, and that's not exactly what she said?

scene.name: dogwood
scene.line: Yeah, alright. Well, maybe asking Weaver about the |Zero| was the wrong place to start. Maybe we should just ask her for specific directions. Her answers are complicated enough without a layer of indirection at the question.

scene.name: find-weaver
scene.line: I saw Weaver at my workshop. That's up north by Lake Nolin, right at Wax and Peonia, in the back of a bait shop. Pretty glamorous, right? These are the times we live in.
She's either up there or back at the farmhouse. Whichever you want to head to first, just let me know.
